abstract: A court in Munich struck down a challenge to the will of Cornelius Gurlitt, the son of a Nazi-era art dealer who had bequeathed a trove of artworks to the Kunstmuseum Bern in Switzerland.

headline.main: German Court Upholds Bequest of Gurlitt Collection to the Kunstmuseum Bern
headline.print_headline: Court Says Art Trove Is to Go to Swiss Museum

snippet: A court in Munich struck down a challenge to the will of Cornelius Gurlitt, the son of a Nazi-era art dealer who had bequeathed a trove of artworks to the Kunstmuseum Bern in Switzerland.
